intro: Cassine anjouanensis, commonly known as the Anjouan cassine, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
